title: Brazilian pharmacy thief kissed elderly woman and told her he didn't want her cash
text:
An elderly woman in northeast Brazil offered to give her money to an armed robber, who told her he didn't need it and kissed her forehead instead.

A surveillance camera inside the pharmacy showed the suspect speaking with the woman while his accomplice robbed the store employee Tuesday afternoon in the city of Amarante.

The frail woman, who lives in a home adjacent to the pharmacy, faced the suspect and told him that she wanted him to take her money as well.

The armed robber tapped her shoulder in an effort to calm her and planted a kiss on her forehead.

An elderly woman (center) attempts to reason with two pharmacy thieves (pictured left and right) and offered to give up her money

But the thief in a motorcycle helmet (right) told the woman (center) that it was not necessary for her to give up her cash and planted a kiss on her forehead

Store owner Samuel Almeida told Brazilian outlet G1 said the men entered the store and asked his employee to give them all of the money.

Almeida said the woman then approached one of the thieves and demanded he taker her money. But he instead kissed her and said, 'no, ma'am, you can be quiet, I don't want your money.'

The thieves escaped the pharmacy with $240 and other goods.

Military police officers canvassed the neighborhood for the suspects, who remain at-large.
